Class IntArrayAlgorithms

  • java.lang.Object
    • IntArrayAlgorithms
  • public class IntArrayAlgorithms
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that contains methods for finding 1) the first, last or all student id with a given score 2) the difference between the maximum and minimum score + 1 3) the number of students within a score range (inclusive)
    Author:
    Anthony Du, Shuhao Liu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      IntArrayAlgorithms()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static int countInRange​(int[] arr, int min, int max)
      accepts an array of integers, a minimum value, and a maximum value as parameters and returns the count of how many elements from the array fall between the minimum and maximum (inclusive)
      static int indexOf​(int[] arr, int val)
      accepts an array of integers and an integer value as its parameters and returns the first index at which the value occurs in the array
      static int lastIndexOf​(int[] arr, int val)
      accepts an array of integers and an integer value as its parameters and returns the last index at which the value occurs in the array
      static java.lang.String listOfIndexWithValue​(int[] arr, int val)
      accepts an array of integers and an integer value as its parameters and returns comma-separated list of indexes at which the value occurs in the array
      static int range​(int[] arr)
      Returns the range of values in an array of integers.

    • Method Detail

      • indexOf

        public static int indexOf​(int[] arr,
                          int val)
        accepts an array of integers and an integer value as its parameters and returns the first index at which the value occurs in the array
        Parameters:
        arr - array of integers to examine
        val - integer value to find in arr
        Returns:
        the first (smallest) index of arr that contains val, or -1 if val is not in arr

      • lastIndexOf

        public static int lastIndexOf​(int[] arr,
                              int val)
        accepts an array of integers and an integer value as its parameters and returns the last index at which the value occurs in the array
        Parameters:
        arr - array of integers to examine
        val - integer value to find in arr
        Returns:
        the last (highest) index of arr that contains val, or -1 if val is not in arr

      • listOfIndexWithValue

        public static java.lang.String listOfIndexWithValue​(int[] arr,
                                                    int val)
        accepts an array of integers and an integer value as its parameters and returns comma-separated list of indexes at which the value occurs in the array
        Parameters:
        arr - array of integers to examine
        val - integer value to find in arr
        Returns:
        comma-separated list of indexes that contains val, or empty string ("") if val is not in arr

      • range

        public static int range​(int[] arr)
        Returns the range of values in an array of integers. The range is defined as 1 more than the difference between the maximum and minimum values in the array. Precondition: array has at least one element
        Parameters:
        arr - array to examine
        Returns:
        range of values in arr
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - with message "Empty array." if size of arr is 0

      • countInRange

        public static int countInRange​(int[] arr,
                               int min,
                               int max)
        accepts an array of integers, a minimum value, and a maximum value as parameters and returns the count of how many elements from the array fall between the minimum and maximum (inclusive)
        Parameters:
        arr - array to examine
        min - minimum value to find in arr
        max - maximum value to find in arr
        Returns:
        count of elements from arr that are between min and max (inclusive)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - with message "Invalid range." if max is less than min
